WRITING.TEXT: I completely understand and I respect your opinion. I just don't like the channel, and I find the writing to be very terrible as either comedy or film analysis. [this is why I don't like them](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=qnTZbZw1JPQ)

I absolutely fucking hate CinemaSins as either comedy or film criticism
Cowboy Bebop. I'd argue with that show and Trigun (another short run series) it changed the way Americans saw anime and helped launch Adult Swim as a mainstay of television.

Fantastic news. Season 4 was different but still great. If you didn't enjoy season 4, I highly recommend multiple rewatches. It all works better when given another look.
I did, but I still thought that it didn't reach the stratospheric heights of the original seasons. A combination of the family members lack of interaction, the writing not being as sharp, the editing allowing for too many jokes that probably should have been cut (Michael and George-Michael one-upping each other's lie comes to mind), and character changes that I consider to be mistakes (mostly in them making Michael a REALLY unlikable jerk).
Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the season (and if you love it, more power to you). I just didn't think it's close to being as good as the original run.

Yeah. I felt like the showrunners should have played TellTale's adaptation of "The Walking Dead" or watch "Stranger Things" to understand how to write well-written kid characters in horror situations, but I do genuinely enjoy The Strain.

* Samurai Jack - Tartakovsky proves he's a master visual storyteller once more with Jack's final season against Aku. With only one more episode left, I feel so happy to see that we got one more season of Jack and I hope that the finale lives up to the anticipation.
* Justified - Just starting out and I'm really loving it. It really scratches my itch for a "modern-day western" series.

WRITING.TITLE: Although it's a bit of a mixed series, the Eichorst/Setrakian discussion in the first season of "The Strain" remains one of my favorite moments in television

I liked the film (including those amazing designs, the casting, and the fantastic soundtrack). I feel like it's a perfect visual companion to the "Hitchhiker" universe. I think it could have benefitted from a second ghost writer to tinker with the script (somebody from a witty rapid-fire writing background), and a bump up in maturity rating to cover more of the adult subject matter in the first book. But I like it as it stands.

I'd recommend Daredevil for a law and order show through the prism of vigilantism. For good character development and mystery, I'd recommend Dark Matter, LOST, The Expanse, The People vs. OJ Simpson, Prison Break, and Justified.
Cowboy Bebop might be a good show.

For 'off-kilter' comedy (with animation recommendations), I'd recommend:
Chosen, Childrens' Hospital, [Smart Guys](http://smartguysshow.vhx.tv/), Moonbeam City, Police Squad!, Metalocalypse, Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law, Black Dynamite, Mike Tyson Mysteries, Aqua Teen Hunger Force, Space Dandy, Red vs. Blue: The Blood Gulch Chronicles, American Dad!, Farscape (this is a weird one. It's a sci-fi show but is so oddly experimental and hilarious that I would near call it a sci-fi dramedy), and the first three seasons of Family Guy (which I still hold as a great comedy because of the pre-cancellation episodes).

A show full of action, conspiracy, and heroism.
With these stipulations, I'd recommend: Daredevil, Jericho, Dark Matter, The Expanse, Prison Break, 24, Trigun
Smart Guys (it's a hilarious online 6-part web series), the first three seasons of Family Guy, 30 Rock (post season 1), Arrested Development, Police Squad!, Moonbeam City, Archer

"Gritty" with no graphic violence might be hard. I'd suggest Prison Break, Daredevil (this does have graphic violence, but it's a great show and given that you have a Jessica Jones icon, I think you can expect that level of violence/gore),The Night Manager, Dark Matter, LOST, and Jericho

Everything in your first paragraph is literally something Trump has done IN OFFICE
Did I SAY that I support what Trump has done in office? You seem to be missing the main argument point that blaming Trump's supporters with racism is like blaming Clinton's supporters for the worst of her world.
WHILE YOU LUMP ME AND OTHERS INTO A BUCKET;
I'm calling you a deplorable when you do lump people into a bucket. The complexity of the argument isn't complex. Claiming all the supporters of Trump hold the same beliefs or condone the actions or words he's said is idiotic. I'm saying the identity politics YOU preach is evil of judging everyone by some "all or nothing" perspective is intellectually dishonest, and you trying to turn that back on me is just plain baffling.
if you vote for Trump, you ostensibly agreed with his anti-Muslim policies (can you explain how you could possibly vote for him and not support them? He made them extremely clear during the campaign)
That's idiotic. That's like saying you couldn't possibly support a candidate because you don't support 100% of their stances. It's like saying that because you voted for Clinton means you fully support all forms of abortion.
Clinton can be a anomalously moral but effective politician that would make a decent president despite the fact that she made some mistakes.
She never admitted to ANY mistakes. She thinks everything else is somebody else's problem, EVEN NOW with Trump.
Trump campaigned on racism and despicable offensive populism and has demonstrated he has no understanding of how to run a government or even what the basic function of the three branches of government are.
He campaigned on economic policies that weren't about shipping jobs overseas, that partial birth abortion was wrong, to repeal Obamacare (I support this given how much much premiums have raised with the coverage), stopping TPP, and ran a campaign without Super PACS. Here's a list of promises: [list](http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/promises/trumpometer/). There's a plethora of ideas he supports that not everyone will be behind, but some may see that as a better alternative to Clinton's proposed promises.
He was the worse choice, hands down, and his supporters are guilty of voting for him. They're never getting forgiven for that, sorry (not sorry).
Your moral outrage of the man doesn't change the fact that not all of his supporters are evil monsters (given that many of them are the same people who voted for Obama). Your inability to listen to other people's perspectives is horrendous and you should honestly be ashamed of that. Your stigmatized point of view rather than sympathizing with other people's perspectives is only going to encourage people to go to anyone who listens to their concerns (especially when economic issues are at the heart of their problems).
Further, he's made it clear he's only interested in using the presidency to enrich himself and his children.
Well, given that he's advocated for causes outside his family I'd say that that statement is a factual lie.

Yeah, those people don't have good judgement.
In comparison to a woman who has done nothing but lie to the public, unethically collaborate with the DNC (against their charter) to beat Sanders, treats the constitution like a suggestion in how she wanted to choose justices, changes opinions with the strongest breeze, committed several felonies, used drone warfare to kill unarmed civilians, and (once again) killed an ambassador and several marines for ego.
Sorry, I'm not about defending racist assholes. If you are, that's cool. I'm not.
People like you are the reason why Clinton lost the election. The only people who deserve to be considered among the "basket of deplorables" are people like you, especially when you lump an entire group of people with a candidate's worst traits or words.
his supporters think Muslims are subhuman so they don't really consider that to be a problem.
You didn't say it was Trump who considered Muslims sub-human. You literally said that it was all of his supporters. Your "all or nothing" attitude is sickening.
Once again, as a reminder: I voted for Clinton, and even then I knew she was a terrible candidate.
The fact that they blame Clinton for Benghazi despite four Congressional investigations that turned up zilch and the fact that the GOP congress denied the funds to man the embassy proves they're even dumber than previously thought.
Not CONVICTING her of zilch isn't the same as committing a horrendous act. Especially since Obama was lying about having contact with her. The Youtube video starting the entire incident? That was an entire lie propagated by her supporters. [Benghazi and the aftermath](https://www.louderwithcrowder.com/benghazi-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-attack-and-its-aftermath/). I don't like Trump, but Clinton was absolutely no saint and the "lesser of two evils" doesn't excuse her actions. I don't blame her supporters for her sins, neither do I blame Trump supporters for Trump's sins.
I also think that the writing just wasn't as on-point as the original three seasons. i think it's also because they included every joke they thought of rather than just the cream of the crop.

People who voted for Trump voted for a person who had dehumanized Muslims. They must be pretty proud of that fact if they voted for him.
Or, crazy thought, maybe they thought he was a better choice in terms of other issues than Clinton. It would be like saying the people who voted for Clinton voted for someone who let an ambassador and several marines get killed over ego. Well, there's a good number of great fight scenes in both TV and movies, but they'd might not have the same concept of "super powers" as Avatar and Korra have in mind.
Here are just some great fight scenes that utilize "a form" of superpower or another (with either one or both sides of the fight), that I think are excellently intertwined in a fight scene:
* The Wolverine: [The Bullet Train fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2cBz_TUmOrE)
* The Amazing Spider-man - [The School Fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10fno5Qpm7w)
* Avengers - [The Forest Fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b41-cDJ5TUw)
* Fullmetal Alchemist - [Metal vs. Fire](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ikowZCwmx-s)
* Captain America: The Winter Soldier - [The Highway fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qXPOl6EjbWg)
* Captain America: Civil War - [The Airport Fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uArWAMAmLDI)
* Trigun: Badlands Rumble - [Vash vs. Gasback](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lvk5H9foyi0)
* Spectacular Spider-man - [Spider-man vs. The Sinister Six](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B4cUf8N86Fg)
* Cowboy Bebop - [Spike vs. Pierrot](https://youtu.be/-6nmTundSn4)
* X-men: Days of Future Past - [The Sentinel Attack](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Y2TlrFVTDc)
* Spider-man 2 - [The Train Fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VUsssa6ArAY)
* Samurai Jack - [Jack vs. Scaramouche](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ony8OIuBVw0)
* Samurai Jack - [Jack vs. Demongo](https://youtu.be/FEw7npcRalU)
* Doctor Strange - [The "Reverse" Fight Scene](https://youtu.be/60QNLyGpFl0?t=51s)
* Star Wars: Return of the Jedi - [Luke vs. Darth Vader and the Emperor](https://youtu.be/YZ_j3s5xj8I)
* Ant-Man - [Ant-man vs. The Falcon fight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EIrsOg9Wqp8)
* Iron Man 3 - [Tony vs. The Mandarin](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZIAaKIsXDw)
* Star Wars: Clone Wars - [Anakin vs. Asajj](https://youtu.be/W19l3rt8HSI)
